title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Great! They asked very reasonable questions and were very kind during the interview. I appreciated that they asked about my strengths, weaknesses, and personality. The interview went smoothly for the HRS student.
Interview Questions: When is a time you struggled? Can you name a time where you ethics came into the workplace?

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was productive and not too long. The questions were mainly about my future and how I may act in certain situations. I thought the process was not only needed, but beneficial for my future growth.
Interview Questions: Share a time where you had to use conflict-resolution.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Ohio State has the standard interview process for physics grad schools. You submit an application and if you are approved, there's an open house you can attend before you make your decision. There was no formal, sit-down interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Super easy and straight forward. The interviewers were super nice, and did interviews over Zoom. Questions included your hobbies, availability to volunteer, how you work with people, and what you want to get out of the opportunity.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a volunteer?

title: Student Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The atmosphere is easy and comfortable. They will first ask some questions about dealing with customers, mostly about your attitudes and they will give you a scenario to test your reaction toward something. Then they will ask if you have any question about the position or something else.
Interview Questions: Q: What if your customer wants a burger but we run out of burgers? What would you say to your customer?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Every internship or work experience I've had through Ohio State has come after a very professional interview. The interviewers ask questions related to the job, but also questions to see if you would fit into the culture you would be working in.
Interview Questions: What skills can you bring to the table?

title: Maintenance Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I wasn't as hard as you'd think. I was nervous but I had to remember I'm interviewing them to see if they fit my standards as an employer. I made sure I had an equal amount of control in the interview. Ask questions related to your job. Make sure you know what they are asking in relation to your work experience.
Interview Questions: General maintenance questions. Leadership and management style. Experience with conflict. Experience with contractor interactions. Following rules and policies.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I had a hour-long virtual interview over Zoom with the position’s direct manager, the unit’s director, another designer and an integrations specialist. It included both personal and technical questions and outlined the role and expectations.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position ?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Process went pretty smooth, I believe I did the interview on Zoom since it was during covid, just met with one of the managers and heard back within two weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe excellent customer service experience.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Went through multiple rounds of interview with materials prepped etc., was told a timeline at every stage that wasn’t kept at all and after the panel interview there was little to no communication for months
Interview Questions: What would you bring to a potluck

title: Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 2 people in person. The people were the only 2 who worked in the SNAPPED program. Interview about getting to know each other followed by a test on Outlook to see how you handle communicating with a team to get information and pass directions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and what you understand about the position.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Very transparent it wasn’t like your typical interview it felt very personal even though it was through as Zoom. I applied and then I got called in for an interview two days later they offered the position a week later so overall, it took me about a month to get into my position!
Interview Questions: What are my weakness and strengths?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by a new professor at the university. Short (20) minute interview. He stated that he is looking for domestic applicants, primarily students who are already attending the Ohio State University.
Interview Questions: Asked about research background, research interests.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: This is super easy and there is no interview at all. You just have to submit your resume and they will most likely hire you. This is a very nice job to have on your resume.
Interview Questions: Please send in your resume.

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Reached out to faculty via email and sat down to discuss my qualifications and interest in the position - got an offer soon after interview. Overall the interview process was pleasant and pretty casual.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Professor asked if I would like to TA, and I said yes. I had already gotten to know him through the semester, so this probably made me a shoe-in to be a TA
Interview Questions: Would you like to TA for my class?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview questions like how did you handle a stressful situation, what are three characteristics that you want to bring into this position? How do you delegate tasks to your teammates?
Interview Questions: What was your most difficult task?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Heard back a few days later via email. There was an initial phone call followed by multiple zoom interviews followed by in-person interview, and then a telephone call with the hiring manager and Human Resources.
Interview Questions: Past work experience. Current classes

title: SNAP-Ed Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Great, I felt comfortable and the ladies were very nice. I didn't feel intimidated and was given plenty of time to think about the question and answer it to the best of my ability.
Interview Questions: How well do you adapt to change?

title: Athletics Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was by far the worst interview of my life. This interview was so terrible that I am leaving a review literally for the first time in my life. OSU flew me out. I heard nothing for two weeks and THEN I found out I didn't get the job due to a Instagram post. AND I STILL haven't gotten an email saying that I didn't get the job. This is absolutely no shade towards the person who got the job, but entire shade towards OSU for being entirely unprofessional. Bad vibes the whole time.
Interview Questions: I don't remember I was too annoyed with the people being on their phone's while they were interviewing me.

title: Academic Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied through WorkDay. Was contacted by the Pharmacy College's HR rep. They asked me general questions. The HR rep didn't know specifics about the position which made things a little difficult. The next round was with the Director of Academic Programs for that specific college. She was very personable. I didn't end up making the final on campus round, but was notified quickly and respectfully.
Interview Questions: A lot of questions about how to handle emotional conversations with students.

title: Student Job Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. You will be in a group with 4 or 5 people. You all will come to a place, there are 5 interviewers. Each of them will ask at least 1 question.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with the lab manager and PI. Interview took weeks to schedule and it was weeks afterwards before I heard back from HR with a salary 5/hr less than what the lab agreed was reasonable and they had “confirmed would work through HR.” They then wouldn’t budge on this.
Interview Questions: What would you bring to our lab as an individual and as a team member?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: They had three interviews in lab, group, and conference room setting and one presentation for the whole group. They invited all candidates in the same meeting too which was a little odd but it went well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join us What’s your future goal

title: Office of Student Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Overly complicated process that should have been a red flag from the start. I need to start off by saying I have had many positive interactions within the university’s various departments; however, this was not one. Interview was moved multiple times due to their scheduling conflicts, apparently the entire team needed to be present for the two-part interview. I just rolled with it thinking maybe it really is a tight team and critical everyone be there. I went in with high energy and extremely excited while I looked around at the team staring off into space paying little to no attention while I answered common boilerplate questions. I have never been put in such and odd interview situation and it really seemed like I was the only person excited too actually be there. I just felt very discouraged after so much prep and importance was placed on the team needing to be there. At the end I was told I would need to “turn-n-burn” projects and the work would only need to be average at best. It struck me a bit odd, but I tried to take it as they just have a heavy workload and wanted to iterate that. Overall, I was not offered the position, thought I would have thought prior experience with the brand and a genuine love for the university would have meant something. After following up I was not even giving the decency of a reply, having been a part of the university for so long and a past student I find this to be rather rude and unprofessional. Again, I have had many positive interactions within the various university departments, however something is off here and be protective of your time and energy.
Interview Questions: Just common questions regarding workflow and juggling multiple projects.

title: Content Marketing Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well and was smooth - was a 1 on 1 interview and typical questions were asked. Position was completely remote with the option of having a desk anywhere from 1 - 5 days a week. If you wanted a desk for under 3 days a week, you could chill in the public spaces on campus to work. Great interviewer, very casual and easy.
Interview Questions: How do your current skills pertain to this role?

title: Risk Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 4-6 months. One phone screen and two rounds face to face interview. Each process took weeks and I thought they are not longer consider me anymore.
Interview Questions: What is Risk? and how do you define it.

title: Staff Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Met with the director of labs for two interviews first one was on Zoom and the second was in person. Took a tour of the labs and layout of the floor then went into the office for the interview,
Interview Questions: Mostly related to experience and knowledge of the lab I was trying to teach.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: A short ~20 minute phone interview first, then a zoom interview--one hour with the directors/associate directors, then another hour with the other research associates, then 30 minutes to complete a task.
Interview Questions: What is a unique strength you have?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone screens and an on-campus interview that was scheduled for half a business day. I had the chance to meet with team members, supervisor, and boss's boss.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you prioritize conflicting project timelines.

title: Student Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Workday and got an email within a few days. They were very accommodating as to where you want to be interviewed. The interview was very relaxed, with no pressure on it.
Interview Questions: What do you think of diversity?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: First round was HR screen to ensure eligibility- then phone interview with committee chair-in person interview with committee and individuals-job talk, tour campus, meet student, potential collaborators, labs, department- decision letter--performed background check
Interview Questions: 5 year plan regarding research programs; teaching philosophy; service plan, etc

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual more like a general conversation about why you wanted the job and a little bit about you interests. We went on tangents about general life things and it was super comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA for this subject and not another one?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth and quick process. They were very helpful through everything. I would recommend looking towards this employer if you are looking for a new job or career path. You will not be disappointed by your decision.
Interview Questions: Steps and processes I would implement if selected to streamline production

title: Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: It was short and to the point. I don’t want to do this. I’m only looking for salaries listed in the website and I’m just typing this to fill the minimum word requirements.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in this field

title: Student Vehicle Operator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very easygoing, and consisted only of talking to one person in their office for around fifteen minutes. Heard back within a week after and had a good experience overall.
Interview Questions: "Please tell me about yourself"

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 2 rounds with managers and department chair, very behavioral and culture focused, with one technical question about balance statements. First round was remote and second was on campus.
Interview Questions: How have you been able to balance remote and in person life since the pandemic?

title: Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Great, very responsive and helpful people and process. Well supported and seamless process for interviewing for this position at Ohio state university. Very happy with how it turned out and who I worked with.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Lasted two months and had three rounds of interviews, the first was a phone interview with an hr rep and the second and third were in person with the team
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by my current manager. My current position was looking for people who are willing to participate and learn the workings of a lab. We had a really nice discussion about all the research the faculty was currently working on. I asked a lot of questions about her work and she was genuinely happy to share her knowledge.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with a difficult situation/failure.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Two times of interview. In the first time, just one professor interview me. In the second time, there are four professor give me the interview.  The question is not too hard to answer.
Interview Questions: Why do you come to this school

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Not a very friendly interview . The panel had a set of questions in front of them and asked the questions as though they were formal exam questions.  It wasn’t like the rest of my interviews with other companies.
Interview Questions: Mostly technical questions about the field.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (El Paso, TX) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Industry standard interview process with lots of back and forth question and answering. beside a lot paperworks need to be completed before the hiring process. overall it was  a easy process.
Interview Questions: what are my research interest

title: Exhibit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Had a very quick follow up after submitting application. 
Within three weeks had a zoom interview with six staff members and had received the interview questions two days prior to the call.
Interview Questions: What appeals to you about this role

title: SNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the student nurse assistant position and then received an invite for an online interview that was recorded, I though it would be with a person but it was not, and it was a series of 8 questions, 1 minute to think in-between.
Interview Questions: Rate the hospitals 1-3 from first choice to last choice and why?

title: Video Assistant Football Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: No interview was done. Simple email process back and forth. Show your interest, come to practice and try out and you were hired. You don’t even meet the director. Pretty easy and straightforward
Interview Questions: Why would you like to do this job?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Lima, OH)
Interview Descriptions: A huge committee asking almost impossible to prepare for questions for $16/hr. Had to give a 30 minute presentation on OSU. Very difficult interview process for the pay. It would have been better if they were to let the interviewees present on a topic they felt comfortable with to truly showcase presentation skills.
Interview Questions: Give a 30 minute presentation on why a diverse audience should attend OSU

title: Education Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview about 30 minutes just asking education-related questions and scenarios. Two people on the interview panel. Very friendly and very conversational in tone. The second interview was set up much the same way with the same people and one other. Very nice and made me feel at ease.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a difficult colleague.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward questions, felt the interviewers could have been more prepared in all three interviews/5 different interviews. Questions seemed to be pulled from the same questionnaire, as I was asked the same questions by different people multiple times.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? 10 years?

title: Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: first round was just getting a lot of information about the functioning of the team and the department on a day to day basis. next rounds would be interviews and technical questions.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this role?

title: Teacher´s Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth! They just asked if I was comfortable grading papers, handling student info, if i could stay organized and submit grades by deadlines. I was already a student when hired so I believe this helps
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable handling students grades?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual interview. It lasted 15 minutes max. They asked pretty standard questions and gave a lot of information about the position. They asked maybe 5 questions total. The application was also pretty straightforward.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied and then I received an email to ask if I would like to interview and they offered a few proposed times. I followed the exact instructions on the email and went then and sat in the room as requested. He asked me questions about the population, LGBTQIA+ interactions, and more.
Interview Questions: You are not sure of a youth's pronouns, what do you do?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview screening with director. followed up with a campus interview with director, other manager and peers. Discussions and questions with each person or group. HR representative was very helpful navigating the process.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my work, both technical and as a leader.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview. Lasted about an hour. Pretty laid back in my opinion. It was a set of 2 interviews. Supposed to be 3 but one had an appointment during my interview. Passed that interview and got an offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Experience with cloud services and general previous experience.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: zoom, held 1. phone 2. group 3. 1 on 1 with director. Nice people and good employer. ran on time. asked a lot of questions. very relaxed environment. questions were basic but meaningful to job. gave you plenty of time to ask questions.
Interview Questions: how do you handle stress

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: It was extremely nerve racking. I was interviewed by 3 people, all asking questions that did not necessarily pertain to the job itself.  I believe that they wanted to see how I reacted under pressure.
Interview Questions: If we’re to be selected to be an RA, what would you do differently to improve the diversity and inclusion of all of the residence?

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview that was not very difficult. They are always looking for student associates in every different aspect of the university. I did not find the hiring process to be difficult at all.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Student Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions were asked about availability, working with technology in past, and any past experience working on campus. Working a minimum number of hours isn't always required but it's a good campus opportunity in terms of pay.
Interview Questions: Q. What does your availability look like?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: There was a Zoom Interview with potential advisors and a look at undergraduate transcripts. Most importantly we talked about overall career goals and past experiences within the desired field of study.
Interview Questions:
Q: how did you get started In Your field of study. 

Q: what makes you passionate about your field of study?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy process with a video submission, in person interview with multiple groups, and a thorough reference check. It took a long time before I heard back and received an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What are your 5 year career goals.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: After being notified of being selected as a semifinalist, I submitted video answering interview questions (why I wanted to work there, my experience, etc.). I then had an in-person interview with two panels of faculty and stakeholders.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your background.

title: Lab Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the person hiring for about 10 minutes going over basic info regarding the course, some technical questions related to the course, and then I asked some questions of my own..
Interview Questions: Q: What is a high pass filter?

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was virtual over zoom and ran very professionally. Nurse case managers were easy to communicate with and asked relevant questions, while providing insight on job responsibilities and task. Smooth process and I was very impressed with both Units I interviewed with.
Interview Questions: Most were behavior based questions.

title: Inventory Control Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Multiple rounds.
I was reached out by Office Staff Coordinator at Wexner Medical Center to schedule the first round (30 minutes on MS Teams) to be interviewed by Sr. Process Engineers.
Then they rescheduled it because they wanted to change the position title to Resource Planning Analyst. Then they rescheduled it again as they wanted to change the job description.
Then I met the same two people again for an hour-long interview for a more in-depth discussion.
Then I was requested to meet in person to meet the same two people again in person, at OSUWMC as a follow-up interview at my own expense. I had to take a day off from my current job, and drive 3 hours (oneway) early morning to reach for the interview at 8.30 am. After spending a whole day doing literally everything but not a legit interview I WAS GHOSTED by those two process engineers.
NEVER HEARD BACK FROM EITHER. I HAVE CALLED/EMAILED THEM A MILLION TIMES BECAUSE I DESERVED TO HEAR A REPLY. IT WAS FINE IF I DIDN'T GET A JOB BUT A REPLY SHOULD BE APPRECIATED.
Interview Questions: In-person Interview: Tour the OSU-WMC and meet and greet the team and various people working collaboratively with this position. She took me to one of the inventory rooms and asked "What will you do to make this room better?"

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview, not very long, 1 round on the spot did not feel like it was tough and was hired on the  spot as a student at OSU roughly 20 minutes
Interview Questions: Give me a time you problem solved

title: Summer Student Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Technical questions mixed with behavioral questions. Basic situational driven question looking for your thought process development and previous knowledge, experience.  Just one round of in person interview with level 1 and level 2 manager
Interview Questions: Describe a non technical problem that you solved using your technical background

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the prospective boss followed by a full day on-campus visit. Talked to almost every lab’s PI in the department. Everybody was friendly. Was asked to give a short presentation about previous work.
Interview Questions: What are the technical skills that you mastered and what would you like to learn?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: overall it was two interviews, and they were both with zoom video call! the first one was with the supervisor and then presenting in front of  the whole research group
Interview Questions:
-General behavioral questions
-Research questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Basic resume review questions. Was interviewed by two people in the research focus area. Resume review was just a clarification of skills presented on the resume. Nothing too technical or behavioral.
Interview Questions: What is your availability like over the year?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The intervews are virtual now, which is nice. The inter view are fairly laid back, but there are multiple interviewers and I did have to do 3 interviews before getting rejected. However, my resume was passed on and I got to interview for a similar position in another department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Where do you see yourself in this job in the next year?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a set of 2 zoom interviews. Both with set questions but allowed for time to have open discussion afterward. Pleasant experience and there were a total of 3 people interviewing me. Clearly explained title and position objectives.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize and manage your time?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Ask about your past experience related to the research area. You need to speak English fluently and attend the weekly meeting. You need to know at least R and Python to do the work.
Interview Questions: Past experience, current school year, work time

title: Recruitment Host for Admissions Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: They honestly brought me in and treated me like family. Through this position I have made valuable connections that I can rely on in the future. I am honestly grateful for them.
Interview Questions: What was a time when you faced a difficult situation and how did you face it/overcome it?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Very long and drawn out. Process took several months and then a delay in contacting candidates.  Very engaged leaders, some with difficulty seeing past there own experiences. Think approach is
Interview Questions: What is the strategic vision?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, but took a while to start. And actual hiring took much longer.  Met with immediate boss and head of department. Both interviews were easy and had no issues. Only issue was that I asked questions about upward mobility but I was not given much feedback.
Interview Questions: Relevancy in the field of work, education, aptitude, application of degree and skills to work.

title: Financial Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions:
-A phone interview with HR that was focused on background, education, and experience 
-Followed by a phone interview with the Operations -Team.  This included management and senior leadership about specific questions in regards to resume.  
-Followed by a in person interview with leadership team.  This was a panel interview and included 6 people from the surrounding departments.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel like you would be a good fit?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview

title: Project Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions:
I applied via the OSU website. Shortly after the post closing date, I was excited to hear from a recruiter. We scheduled a phone interview. The phone interview was short, sweet, and pleasant. After that, my info was passed to the hiring manager for review. I was thrilled to hear that I was picked to interview.  

I was informed who would be in my panel interview (names, titles) which helped, so that I could look everyone up on LinkedIn. Panel interviews are cringe-worthy (and cruel in my opinion), and I personally don't do as well when there are 3+ people. In this case, there were 6 people (including the recruiter).  I understand that hiring managers like to do this because they want the opinions of other people who’ll work with the person, but I feel it was done to excess here. Only barely 3 of those people really should've been there, it seems. 

I will say, the parking situation is horrendous. I was given a map showing which lots to park in, only to arrive and find the closest lot full. I found openings in the farther lot, and had to figure out how to pay for parking. This involved downloading the Parkmobile app and creating an account, etc. (Would’ve been nice to be told of in advance, so that I could've had it done prior.) After all that, I had to walk a 1/2 mile (not exaggerating) in heels and a skirt, in cold weather. Salt in the wound: when I reached the building, I saw Visitor Parking right outside, which I could've used, but wasn’t told about. 

Once inside, my recruiter greeted me, and we stood waiting for our giant meeting room to free up. The interviewers started to trickle in and stand with us awkwardly. I was trying to thaw out, plus ignore the pain in my knees from the walk, while trying to be professional and social, and not say anything stupid - fun stuff! Usually when you interview, you don't stand around socializing at first, so this was a new one. 

Of course, once the room freed up and we got started, it broke the ice and we got on track. The interview felt a bit...forced...as panel interviews often do. They went around the table, each person getting to ask a scripted question. A few of the interviewers seemed a little bored to be there (I don't think they thought they needed to be there either).

By the end of the time slot, I felt really good. I felt like I had warmed everyone up and really jived with the hiring manager especially. The recruiter escorted me out, and she said they were finishing interviews by EOW and she'd be in touch next week, etc. 

I did all the proper thank-you's, and was so hopeful the next week for my phone to ring. It did not.  I emailed the recruiter politely (after about 7 or 8 business days) for any updates on the decision. No reply. 

At this point, I was in the dark - no clue if they’d decided to not hire after all, had to delay the hiring, etc. I read from other Glassdoor reviewers that they experienced the same, only to get a call a few months later that they got the role. I doubted that would happen here, but you never know. I decided to discontinue following up, and just let it go. The recruiter had been in fast, open contact with me previously, so I knew that if they wanted to reach me, they would.

I only know that the position is filled because the status of my application finally changed to “Position Filled” in the OSU employment portal. 

To be honest, I’m really disappointed in OSU. I couldn't even get the respect of getting an email back from my recruiter in response to my follow-up - not even some canned email saying, "Oh sorry we had so many great candidates to choose from, and it was a tough decision, but we decided to go with someone else." To be cut off like that, with no reply at all, is very disrespectful and unprofessional. Especially after I've taken my time to be there, paid 5 bucks in parking, walked a mile total in the cold (wearing heels!), and sat through a panel interview. What a shame.
Interview Questions: What was a time you failed, and what would you have done differently?

title: Mid-Level Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was informal and fairly easy.  I got the sense that they were not interested in me almost immediately.  It was a panel interview -- 3 white males in a male-dominated industry.  The HR generalist explained that they were interested in my qualifications since my experience fit the position.  However, shortly into the interview a member of the panel asked me to discuss my experience in an area that was not noted in the position description.  I addressed his question in detail and as I directed my answer to the other 2 on the panel, I was shocked to see one of the panel members reading (texting?) on his phone and paying no attention during the interview.  The director was on his phone throughout the 40 minute discussion.  In general, I found the panel members to be rude, aloof, and inexperienced at conducting an interview.  This is certainly not what I would expect from a university -- especially Ohio State.  Needless to say, I saw no point in writing a "thank you" email to anyone on the panel and I withdrew my interest immediately -- in the position and Ohio State University.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Called within 24 hours of submitting my resume. I had a 50 minute phone interview that was very friendly and not too complicated. I was very qualified for the position as I have been doing the same work for many years, but did not move on to the next round for panel interview. I had to email the phone interviewer to find out about my status and they responded 4 days later. I followed up for feedback to improve candidacy, but they did not respond to this.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Application portal online. Was invited for in-person interview 4-6 weeks later. Didn't hear anything for 3-4 months during which I reached out to the interviewer twice. After some time I saw the position re-post. Guess I didn't get the job, I didn't contact interviewer again.
Interview Questions: How do you motivate different types of people?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
1. Applied online at jobsatosu.com
2. Invited for in person interview via telephone/e-mail (60+ applicants - interviewed 5)
3. Interview with two staff members and HR employee
4. Heard back one week later and was told that I had a lot of experience but they wanted someone who had more experience working with faculty members at OSU or another university (non-staff members like professors)
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working and interacting with faculty members at the university?

title: Steward Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The hiring manager called me a week or two later and we had an informal phone interview, and afterwards he offered me the job. They sent documentation via email the next week.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult customers?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: There is an app., essay, and an interview process in front of 2-3 people. It was stressful, but the people are nice. It was stressful, but the people are nice.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time when you overcame a challenging situation.

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. Come prepared with a basic resume (or in some cases the one you previously submitted is enough). Usually another student is doing the interview so it feels very laid back; however, this definitely does not make it any less serious. A big part of the interview was the interviewer giving a hypothetical situation with a customer and asking you how you would handle the situation. They are especially looking for strong leadership skills.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Security Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I tested for my abilities and experience in this type of work. I was then contacted by a supervisor who set up an interview within the week. I sat before a board of 5 very professional and experienced public safety employees who, in a very relaxed environment asked me specific questions and for examples of my past experiences. This was rather refreshing being that they were not the usual interview questions.
Interview Questions: Described past security experience.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview ending with a demonstration. Consisted of myself and three of the department heads. They asked the typical interview questions, and ended with a 8 minute demonstration on how to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to keep control of your presentation even with young children?

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did a first round in person interview with Ohio State. It was a really simple and straight forward interview. Alll of their questions were based on their 4 core values - community, learning, inclusion, and wellness. There was one question for each value, and it was basically "How do you incorporate x into your work?"
Interview Questions: How do you incorporate wellness into your work?

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just a quick meet and greet with the Dietetics lead after a review of your resume. Interviewer was very kind nice but it took a while to confirm the interview itself.
Interview Questions: Are you a student?

title: PGY1 Pharmacy Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a written application, I interviewed on site during a tour of the various residency positions within the OSU Residency Program. I had a chance to observe each of 3 various primary practice sites, as well as interview with the current residents and residency preceptors and director.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to complete a community pharmacy residency?

title: Resource Planning Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone interview. The recruiter said he would present my information to the hiring team. I was selected for an in-person interview. The interview was scheduled for 2 hours. I met with the whole team in the interview. I was asked to bring a work sample. It has been over a month but I have not heard back even after a follow up email. I assume I was not selected.
Interview Questions: Give an example of working in a cross-departmental project.

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an hour long, asked very basic questions of coding languages pertaining  the job. Was not given an offer immediately, but was emailed fa couple months later asking me if I still was interested in the position, which I was.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between private and public classes in Java?

title: CFAES - Project Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Group interview. I believe that they were seeking a warm body to fill a vacancy. It did take a long time to actually move the process along. The team was very inviting. Just seemed like a "get to know you" session.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about yourself.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took about half an hour and they asked  general  behavioral questions including please introduce your self and why did you want to apply for the position and so on. The process was smooth
Interview Questions: What's your weakness?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked professor if they had research opportunity.  The professor I emailed had a position and my qualifications fit the position.  They want to know if you are really interested in researching in the group and that you want to go to graduate school.  In my case I would like to do both.  Great opportunity.
Interview Questions: What interested you in this research group?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is easy and simple. You fill out an online form and the manager calls you if they like your answers or if you have relevant experience. Then there is a short 10-15 mins interview asking basic questions. the manager will let you know if they want you or not right then. You start working soon after that. you have a 2 day oreintation for which you get paid and also some skills training for which they pay you.  It a simple process overall.
Interview Questions:
WHy do you wnat work here?
why do you like dining services?
have you worked in dining servies before?
have you worked as a sales person before?

title: Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by the senior team of the research lab who were working on the major grant that is being hired through.

I came in with resumes for everyone and we began. I was asked a series of questions varying from technical expertise to personal hobbies. 

At the end, I was told to keep my ear out for a call for my references.
Interview Questions: How do you handle high pressure situations?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: They had a two cut process. One was online application and another was a in person interview. The in person interview weigh significantly as you must answer key points and you are rated right after the interview. There were many applicants for this position. I also had to interview with a potential Hall Director in order to see if I would be a good fit with them. After this was completed I was given an offer.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to be a RA/CA?

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short and sweet sit down. Lengthy certification and training process. The head trainer has a very strong background in sports and fitness, so there is also a practical process where you have to prove your skills through demonstrative effort. You must also pass the certification exam and achieve a satisfactory score on the entrance exam while also providing certification in CPR/AED.
Interview Questions: What do you do when your client feels sick?

title: Director of Youth and Family Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a one-on-one interview with a woman who would be my immediate supervisor. After that interview, there was a panel interview with five women asking me questions. The panel interview was intimidating, and three out of the five women kept poker faces the entire time. The overall experience was not awful and I was surprised to learn that I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: One thing the panel asked me was have I had trouble with people of color on the job and, if so, how did I handle it.

title: Media Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very formal, at first, compared to what I'm used to. An assistant set up the interview with me via phone and email, set ample documents about an interview itinerary (that was a first), parking, etc. Once I met with the two folks I was interviewing with, though, it was less formal and comfortable. They were very professional, seemed genuinely interested in me and what I was saying. It was also more of an intellectual conversation, rather than being grilled. I appreciated their professionalism while also being sociable and welcoming.
Interview Questions: What type of people do you not work well with?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then brought in for an interview. The employees were friendly and easy to get a long with. I can see how it is very competitive to get a job with Ohio State.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite book to read?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a standard on campus interview. they asked about major and sills for the job. They asked about any past experience that could be helpful. They asked about other things like schedule and understanding of task and the like.
Interview Questions: What makes you a team player?

title: Dining Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Asked some basic question by manager and hand in your schedule time sheet.Then they will ask where do you want to work and which type of working you prefer, also they would tell you the training and working hour if you are hired
Interview Questions: Do you have previous experience working at dining service

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: very short and sweet. A few common questions regarding strength and weaknesses and position at the university with your future Resident Manager, then you were out of there. Everyone was super freindly, not intimidating at all
Interview Questions: Name one weakness

title: Nurse Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic and then face to face meeting. we reviewed my history and why I wanted to work at that site. We discussed the position and the requirements needed for the job.
Interview Questions: why should they hire me.

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: No interview required, so it was really easy. Only have to submit paperwork (tests, essay questions?, letters of recommendations), and if pass the screening, get offered a position. At least for my department (physics), will then be given the opportunity to come to the open house, where they try to convince you to attend Ohio State. Basically, a few days of tours, free food, and getting to know the faculty/ other students.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the department heads as well as the dean of the individual college.  It was an informal chat where they discussed my prior experience, my interests, and what I could contribute to the college.  They were very friendly and there was little to no pressure.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for this position?

title: Building Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: A brief phone call was made to me and we discussed some of the aspects of the business and my qualifications for the job.  There was no follow up and the only reason I knew that I didn't get the job was because they changed the positions listing from "searching" to "filled."
Interview Questions: Do you know what it means to be a five star hotel?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Rather difficult to get a call back when you enter your application through the traditional portal; it helps if you know someone who works there. I had one phone call with the manager and then was called in for an interview. After the interview, I sat down with members of the staff and they asked me routine questions and allowed me to ask them more questions about the overall environment.
Interview Questions: How well can you deal with stressful situations

title: Welcome Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
There is a group interview process. The main idea is to see if you can effectively communicate with others and have the knowledge of the campus and the cities.
The next step is to let the group take turn to answer the questions, the questions are all the subjects that relates to life experiences
Interview Questions: If your activities encounter the unanticipated bad weather, what you will do?

title: Apple Certified Mac Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple, one time interview. Straight up questions. Easy questions that tested a general working knowledge of the skills that would be required to discharge the duties of the position. No tricks.
Interview Questions: "what is your experience, in general, with repairing hardware?"

title: Assistant Professor Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: they take great care of you, scheduling all your travel arrangements. applied on line, then talked to recruiter then chair of dept division. then went out for interview. offer followed soon after
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took a very long time. Just over a month from the time the application is submitted to the time I accepted the offer. The online application process was very tedious. There are several questions to fill out, plus filling out all the previous job experience and salary information. When I was called in for an interview, I met several managers who sat around a table with me and asked me several questions. That can be a bit unnerving if you are not used to several people interviewing you at the same time. A lot of the interview was about personality. How well can you interact with the clients and with the team. Some of the interview was about previous experience.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about telling people No?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal and easy. I came in for a ten minute interview that went over my resume and qualifications. They asked some behavioral questions and that was at all. The interview was at a dining hall. I was hired on the spot. If you seem like a good person they will hire you right away and you will start training very soon.
Interview Questions: What would you do if there was ever a conflict between a worker and a customer?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I went in for the interview and the supervisor told what the job entailed and asked me a few general questions. He had basically decided to hire me before I even came in for the interview. If you are fortunate to e-mail or contact at the right time, you've pretty much got the job because there are no real qualifications. It's just an entry level job.
Interview Questions: What experience I had previously

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I just had to submit my resume along with my preferences as an email to the Graduate chair and then they shortlisted by CGPA. After this i had a discussion with the professor where he asked me some basic questions
Interview Questions: What are your subject preferences and Why

title: CSE Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone, when are you available to start, started immediately. I think they should require an assessment of some sort or increase the minimum grade requirement in order to have this position. A lot of my coworkers are not skilled in this course and therefore cannot help students
Interview Questions: When are you available to start

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews. There was an online application that I filled out. 
I was contacted by a member of the research team to schedule an interview. 
The first interview lasted about an hour and the second interview lasted 45 mins. No update on salary.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want this job?
What do your days consist of?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It cannot be called an interview since it is just a free conversation about what you like. Like what do you think of something. I cannot remember what the question is. But it is a great interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have programming experience?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview went about 25 mininues. They will asked about the introduction of yourself. Then you just go over the information on the resume. The most important question is about the planning of your academic career. Make sure to mention about the research plan, thinking about applying the master degree.
Interview Questions: What course are you taking right now?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly relaxed but informative. I learned more about that studies that the research team was involved in. I also discussed about what my role would be in the team, what types of things I would be learning, and what else I needed to do. I was informed that I needed to get a background check which took quite a long time since I'm not American.
Interview Questions: Would you be comfortable shadowing a psychologist and sitting in on assessments?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Position was for Fisher College of Business. Applied online and heard from them really quickly - within a day - which from what I've gathered is pretty amazing since everyone says OSU tends to have a slow hiring process. Interview was scheduled for about a week later with a director and associate director. The staff was extremely friendly and easy to talk comfortably around. They were very team oriented and presented a fun fast-paced work environment. Asked quite a few questions but were also very informative and it was nice that they told me exactly what they liked about my resume from the get-go so I knew what skills to focus on when I answered. At the end, they said they would be in contact with me within a week or two because they were hoping to hire quickly. It's been almost a week - fingers crossed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Application process was fairly lengthy with many essay questions about the pillars of the department (community, inclusion, wellness and learning). After application was reviewed, offered an interview that consisted of ~10 questions gauging how you would perform in the position and your understanding of the roles and responsibilities of the job
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you worked with someone different than yourself

title: Cafe Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was through an on line application. then i got an email informed me to schedule  a face to face interview with the manager. i got the offer that day through an email as well. it was very fast and easy.
Interview Questions: when will you be available to work

title: Systems Specialist Business College Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: From the time of the application to the time of an actual first interview was about 3-4 weeks. Interview was good and conducted in a professional manner. The questions were all about what you would expect for the position. If you do your homework you should be fine as long as someone's friend isn't pegged for the position.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't a real difficult question, for this position but there were a couple of active directory questions but there were basic

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Since I was on campus at that time, I emailed the professor that I am interested in and scheduled a face to face interview in the office. After a few days, I received the offer.
Interview Questions: What is your research experience?

title: Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with a panel. Second interview was over skype, also with a panel. Third interview was in-person. First with executive director, then with hiring manager, then a presentation to a large group. I was asked to present on a topic relevant to the role.
Interview Questions: How would you advise a student wishing to change careers?

title: Window Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is very easy. After you submit your application online, you might receive an email from the supervisor. During the interview, she or he will ask general questions about you, what kind of CSE courses you have ever taken, and your available time and day.
Interview Questions: What kind of CSE courses have you ever taken?

title: Banquet Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very easy. The manager was very friendly and i got the job right on the spot. Just asked me what days i could work and how many hours i was looking for.
Interview Questions: When would you want to start working

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions:
Initially you need to fill out the application form online
Then you need to Call and fix appointment for interview
Interview would be mostly towards behavioral type of questions
Once the Interview is done you will be sent either an offer letter or a reject letter based on your performance in the interview
Once you get the offer letter you need to complete the paper work to get the starting date
Interview Questions: What makes a team sucessful

title: Project Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: A consulting firm assisted with the hiring process, which included an over the phone interview and in person interview with the staffing agency, then interview with the company and after the consulting firm performed background checks and drug testing
Interview Questions: specific experience with fiber outage

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Well there was not much an interview process for me.  Went to the advisor's office, talk a little about what I did at graduate school, went over the project they wanted me to work on, and I signed the one year contract.
Interview Questions: Tell me the project that you enjoyed the most?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was persistent and applied for the job more than once in order to get an interview. There was one 1:1 interview with the future boss. It was very straightforward and easy. Asked the basic interview questions. Need a keen eye for detail. I was offered the position a couple weeks after the interview and started within the month.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest fear?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It was one to two months after I applied online that I got the interview. I think there were well over 100 applicants and less than five interviewees. I was interviewed by two managers and one support staff. They were incredibly welcoming and I heard back within two weeks.
Interview Questions: The standard: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses.

title: Member Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Submit your resume online and then you will receive a email from the manager to tell you fill out a survey and then they can know more about you. The interview is easy and all behavioral questions and it is a group interview.
Interview Questions: No Difficult question.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a typed application that was handed in. Afterwards, a smaller pool of applicants was asked to come in to interview. The interview was with the AHD and another office assistant. The questions were all behavioral.
Interview Questions: How would your friends describe you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with Travel, Pcard and Expediting Department. It is not hard. The manager just asked me the past working experience, graduation day and the hobby. She is very kind and encourage me to talk more about myself. I really love my job. I worked in the Expediting team and have great working experience to prepare for the future full time job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview for this position. The only requirement is that you need to get an A in the this course that you are going to grading on, and you'd better have enough when student keep asking you same questions
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Rigger/Stagehand Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: My roommate was approached by Aaron Thomas and was asked if he would be interested in a job down rigging shows at the Schottenstein Center. This job opportunity was then relayed to myself where I then went in for a person interview. Here Aaron asked me a few questions about my past job experiences, did a background check, and hired me. It was a very comfortable laid back interview.
Interview Questions: The only one I could possibly think of would be when he asked me if I was afraid to be 100 feet in the air walking the rafters. I already knew this would be part of the job but I guess hearing it in person definitely made my stomach drop for a second.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just talk about my research experience and how could I contribute to the project. The possible topics which were undergoing were also been introduced to me. And I have to chance to actually choose the topic that I felt interesting.
Interview Questions: What courses have you taken?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: many applicant the year before, must be punctual with dates. it helps to have friends / acquaintences in University Housing. I knew one of the directors. Once the initial screening happens, the group interviews come. they screen out mass amounts of people thorough watching team building events and how you lead and can play nice with a team. after group interviews are individual interviews with housing directors that liked you in the group sessions. this is the time to be punctual to the T and dressed to impress. they want personality!
Interview Questions: how many golf balls would it take to fill this room?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the position four months after submitting application (cover letter, CV, research statement, teaching statement- ~15 pages in total). I received the offer a few weeks after the interview and was officially hired after negotiations after another two weeks. I started work a few months later.  The entire process was about eight or nine months from the time I applied to my start date.
Interview Questions: What was my reason for not publishing more?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was granted an in person interview. Everyone was extremely kind and welcoming. I sat with three of the leadership team and had a fine conversation. They asked me questions and allowed me to ask questions of them. Very friendly, much more conversational than I expected.
