Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was their interest in my travels from my business semester abroad, which had been noted on my application. It wasn't particularly difficult, rather it caught me off guard that it would be of interest to them.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Inperson interview with the Chair of the department, another faculty member and a rep from HR. Lasted about an hour. Was offered the position three days later after they checked my references.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: We talked about my class schedule and past experience. The supervisor is very nice. And then we talked a lot about my school life, hobbies and many interesting things. It was a very relaxing interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your hobby?

title: Ross Mathematics Program Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
No formal Interview process, just asking about your math classes and math experience. As well as rec letters.

They also wanted you to write an essay answering questions about yourself such as your interest, hobbies, background and math classes taken.It helped if you had done the program before so you could just tell them about the math classes you have taken this year and what you were working on at the moment, as well as your major.
Interview Questions: Describe your mathematical background.

title: CPC Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview with HR.  The had me come in to interview with the manager in person.  During the in person interview the tested my coding skills.  HR called to offer the position.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to Job?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It was cool. No hard questions. To the point. work related only
Interview Questions: What additional non-research based responsibilites can you handle

title: Reseaech Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward.   They accomodated foe rescheduling.  Asked questions about management and organizational skills,  software knowledge and past work experiences with similar work.
Interview Questions: How would yiu determine thw priority of project if you are given multiple projects at one time?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Face to face in depth question and answer process with regArd to my knowledge of the course content. After asking specific subject questions I gave detailed answers with regards to the subject matter and how I would present it to students.
Interview Questions: My specific knowledge of specific course content.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: We just had a conversation and dicusssed the future and how we will proceed. Went through a demo after. It was easy. Was kinda surprised by it.
Interview Questions: Can you code?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: interview with seniors on staff then panel interview with other workers
Interview Questions: what is one of your short comings

title: Senior Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Disorganized. Interview schedule not provided until night before my flight out, including being asked to present on a requested topic. Did not allow enough time for various meetings or present any sense of what they wanted out of the position. Overall, a lack of professionalism and administrative competence was on full display—canary in the coal mine..
Interview Questions: What type of institution would you ideally see yourself working for?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Had to apply online first.  General information, and a few broad essay questions that focus on diversity, problem solving, etc.  If you do well with that (and there is no reason you shouldn't), plus you have a 3.0+ GPA, you get to the interview.  The interview questions are behavioral in nature, dealing with conflict mediation, diversity, stress, etc.  After that, you have the RA class.  It used to be that one would be hired after the class; now you will be hired before.
Interview Questions: There were no hugely technical questions.  Just be prepared for answers to conflict mediation and diversity.  Think about the position, and be honest in your answers.

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Discuss my learning experience for the course. Prove problem solving skills and sense of responsibility.  Discuss my learning experience for the course. Prove problem solving skills and sense of responsibility.
Interview Questions: How do you like the course?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group meeting presentation, ask what are the expectation, show my ppt, ask question, and they showed me the lab and the department, tell me about their research, and ask about my previous experience.
Interview Questions: Any question for them?

title: Compensation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: There is only one-time interview because it's only a internship. I heard from them within a week. It was pretty quick. The manager is really nice. The recruiter was pretty nice on answering all the questions that I have.
Interview Questions: your experience in HR

title: Clinical Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed process with relevant questions and excellent interaction.  Met with all the relevant people and found all of the interviewers to genuinely be interested in answering my questions and addressing any concerns.  Overall excellent experience.  No complaints.
Interview Questions: What was your main motivation to become a doctor?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Schedule appointment with professors in charge of lab and senior phd students working there. The interview asked questions related to past experience and motivation to study and a focus on details.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. I received an email a few weeks later for an in person interview with the hiring manager and another person from the department. They were all standard questions to see how you would fit in with the position. I thought I did a pretty good job highlighting my strengths and showing them why I would be great for the job, but I guess they found another person who was even more fitting (or so I was told in an email from the hiring manager).
Interview Questions: What would make you stand out from the other candidates?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Poorly organized and unprofessional. I've seen  students welcomed more warmly and with a greater sense of purpose. Terrible first impression. There was nothing difficult about it other than overlooking clear indolence and poor administrative practices.
Interview Questions: There was nothing difficult about it other than overlooking clear indolence and poor administrative practices. There was nothing difficult about it other than overlooking clear indolence and poor administrative practices. There was nothing difficult about it other than overlooking clear indolence and poor administrative practices.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fast interview. They just asked a few generic questions and about experience. Just answer them with common sense. If you´re a student you will almost certaintly be hired. All in all the hiring process took a little bit more than a week.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in a diverse environment?

title: Physics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal, quick, and painless with the manager of the tutoring operation. I spoke briefly about my experience with the Physics department at Ohio State, as well as some other coursework and research I had done.
Interview Questions: No technical questions were asked. We really only discussed my experience  at Ohio State.

title: Grader/Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The manager will look at your transcript see if you get A level grade, and if yes, you basically hired and you can choose a time preference on schedule. Then you sign several contract and if you are international student, you need to apply for SSN and fill out some off-tax form.
Interview Questions: What's the grade of this course when you took it.

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was by committee with five managers. Be prepared. They have standardized questions that each of the members ask. Most of the questions were behavioral. There is also three role playing questions.

The role playing is based on how you think through a problem. I didn't do well on one of the questions; actually missed it completely. The real reason they do it is to see how you think things through. Getting it right or wrong isn't the point.
Interview Questions: The second role playing question dealt with a pop-up blocker. The interviewer acted like a customer that couldn't make a response to a forum.

title: Entrepreneur-in-residence Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a promotion within the university and required networking with a lot of the Deans and Senior Administrators within the university. The interview process was a lot of questions around technology commercialization and technology transfer. Following this 1-on-1 questions, I was given a tour of the research facilities on the campus, had several meetings with campus leadership as well as with entrepreneurial focused student organizations. The entire process of the interview was 2 weeks from the time I began the process to an offer letter.
Interview Questions: Explain the licensing agreement types between Federally funded research and privately funded research?

title: Student Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: It takes months to hear from them after filling out the application online.  You will go through two interviews.  The first being with several staff members that you will be working with.  The second interview is with the Director.  They require a Bachelor's degree, but you will find that the supervisors may not have a degree.  It is a long and drawn out process.
Interview Questions: You will be hired based on your personality and ability to follow the rules.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The position requires networking with professors who can support you. I found the lab I work in by going over all the different labs on the department website and narrowed them down to three that sounded interesting. I did some background research and emailed the professor about open potions for funded research.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do and why do you want to work in this lab.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed which each of the 6-person team for about an hour. Mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How do you manage parent expectations for a program?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: You first need an admit, once admitted you can send an email to the professor you are interested to work with and wait for his reply. Do send your resume. Mention you past experiences and how is your background fit for the research. If selected expect that sometimes your professor might switch your position with teaching assistantship.
Interview Questions: Every professor in every university is different, it would be better to meet his/her student before meeting with the professor itself.

title: Systems Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then On-Site interview with whole team. After that, having hands-on test with desktop
Interview Questions: Customer Services scenario.

title: Telecounselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone and in person interview. We were interviewed in a group and by a group panel. Very good work environment and was shown around the office. Very good interview in general.
Interview Questions: Asked situational questions

title: Admissions Office Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just asked about major, why I am attending OSU and hours of availability. That was back in 2013. Now they ask more questions. They got a new manager. She will ask basic behavioral questions like group experience.
Interview Questions: Why here at OSU and what is your major?

title: RPAC Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was an audition process in which you performed a brief routine in front of a panel of judges. You were able to create your own routine/select your own music that you wanted to perform.
Interview Questions: It was an audition process in which you performed a brief routine in front of judges.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was extremely simple. I applied online, and sent my chief of staff an email with the copy of my resume and a cover letter. In about two weeks, I had received an email to set-up an interview. My interview was on a Wednesday, and I knew by the following Monday whether I was hired of not.
Interview Questions: In all honesty, the questions were extremely simple. It was team-building based, since student staff always works together. They wanted to see whether or not we were truly interested in the job or not. Overall, extremely simple. I would not worry at all. Just be yourself and show interest.

title: Lab Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a pain initially.  Was not reimbursed for parking costs and had to park in the garage far away from the building. Was asked a lot of stupid questions not pertinent to the job itself. I was told that was room for advancement when there actually was not.  I was offered the position a week later by email.  It was straight forward and uncomplicated.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest challenge at your last job and what did you learn from it?

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Powell, OH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview
Interview Questions: The interview team consisted of four highly educated adults who for whatever reason asked the same questions an hr person from a department store asks the potential part-time associate.  Asked how in the past had I handled delivering bad news or how would I respond to a negative comment  questions seem shallow and unprepared. And no I did not get the job.  The HR did email me that I didn't make the first cut but to keep trying which I did sincerely appreciate.

title: Production Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions, directed at college students. Nothing out of the ordinary. Asks basic question about previous employment, experience, volunteering, etc. Will ask you to name examples of experiences and to list your academic studies, extracurricular activities, hobbies, etc.
Interview Questions: Name one time you went out of your way to help a customer...

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: two rounds interview. The first round is basic background interview, and the second round is group interview where three candidates get to know the entire team and get asked questions
Interview Questions: What do you think is entrepreneurship?

title: Senior Systems Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, then face-to-face technical interview. Second interview was for making an offer
Interview Questions: "Describe how you would work with difficult people"

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact was an informal connection with a recruiter.  Application is made by way of their online system, but I also identified and directly contacted the hiring manager.  Their process drags on at times and I interviewed with several people, but never more than once with the same person.  The primary interview was with a group of staff, including the recruiter and the individual who would supervise the position, along with two others.
Interview Questions: It was a standard interview.  They used a prepared list of questions.  None were overly difficult, challenging or out of the ordinary.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typical customer service questions such as how you would handle a difficult patient, an employee who has violated patient privacy, a difficult manager.  What is the one reason you would like to work in this position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient who is becoming irate with you on the phone?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: the interview is brief, and the PI did't ask to many questions, I asked several questions during interview, and i got offer in 1 week after the interview. I was asked to tell PI more about my skills, and also do I have any idea of the lab development and management
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University
Interview Descriptions: Audition and good academic standing was required to receive a scholarship from the Men's Glee Club.  You also had to be an active participant in the group itself.  This group can end up being a personal and profession support system for any young professional.  Other responsibilities come if you run for office of the organization.  This is a difficult process and requires political campaign and a well written speech in order gain favor from your peers.
Interview Questions: He might ask you to sight read.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with panel of teaching staff as well as directors of early learning center. After,  I was taken on a tour of the facility.  I was encouraged to ask as many questions as possible and observe the various classrooms. I remember thinking I fumbled my words but I was offered the job a few days later!
Interview Questions: Talk about educational theorists you have interest in and why.

title: Graduate Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview was really good. I interviewed with about 6 people in one room which was intimidating but everyone was really nice and a couple of them I had met previously. Interview didnt last long and no odd questions were asked.
Interview Questions: What is your theoretical approach?

title: Law Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submit my resume and then I had a call back interview with two people. They asked general interview questions. The interviewers were kind and did not try to intimidate me.
Interview Questions: They asked how did I become interested in law and questions about my previous employment.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: it was smooth and consistent to the interview process in higher education. I appreciate the transparency of the process. There was no surprise if you have a clear idea of what you are doing and what higher education is about. the colleagues were professional and everything went as planned.
Interview Questions: they asked about my degree

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply online then they call you for interview with your potential manager. Discussion of job duties and your job qualifications and experience.  Good and easy interview process.  Good environment.
Interview Questions: Questions dealt with your prior experience.

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online application followed by a phone interview with 6 people.  I then had to make a presentation to the student employees and the staff, this was followed by a interview with senior leadership, then one on one with hiring supervisor followed by director  I had informal meet and greet with student employees and other staff
Interview Questions: What are your strengths why do you want this job how are you qualified

title: Operations Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 12+ months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Corvallis, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Sit up straight, say something original but relevant to the position, act interested and know why you want it. It is important to make eye contact and act confident and act confident but not cocky.
Interview Questions: What you would do if someone got seriously hurt.

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The person who interviewed me was very nice. She was a Director of HR. There was an initial phone interview (by the same person), and then I met her in person.  I didn't get the job, but she called me personally to let me know.  All of the questions were mostly behavioral interview questions.
Interview Questions: Explain how you convinced someone to do something that they didn't want to do.  What was the result?  Would you have done anything differently?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The manager of the dining hall conducted the interview at the front of the house. It lasted maybe 30 minutes. There were about 6 questions. At the end of the interview, he gave his feedback and offered me a job and asked what my availability was. He said he likes to give immediate feedback when he interviews prospective employees. I know that not every hiring manager is like that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when a problem arose at work, and how you helped to solve the problem.

title: Climbing Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the coordinator my resume and cover letter. It definitely helps to know someone who already works there, but it's still very possible to be hired if you don't. Usually two people interview you, but sometimes a 3rd (I know from experience). Very laid back, don't be afraid to make jokes.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a difficult task you were faced with and how you overcame it. What did you learn from your experience?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: First, an online application (jobs are typically posted for one week, opening and closing on Sundays). Second, a phone interview. Lastly, an in-person interview in the office in which I would be working. Interviewers included my future supervisor, an office manager, and another representative from the office. The interview took around an hour and was fairly relaxed and conversational. I did provide a short presentation based on a prompt that was provided when the interview was scheduled a week or two prior.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Laid back conversation with professors who want to employ you. Typically related to your own research interests and skill set. My experiences have been very positive on the whole. Professors typically want to help you develop and have an incentive to see you build your research agenda.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research interests

title: OCIO PPMO Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Fairly comprehensive, fair, presentations required. there were separate meetings with various senior leaders. the format was free form - questions and discussion. I was asked to describe my past work experience, why I left my last employer. They were hospitable - I was flown in and treated well.
Interview Questions: how would I implement resource management

title: UNIX Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was formal and simple. Had telephonic and then personal interview. There was technical round and HR. They asked few basic questions. Lessons learnt from your previous job, what i liked baout my previous jobs and what I didnt etc. What is my expectations and how do I deal stress and annoying co-workers etc
Interview Questions: Brief your employment history ? why should we hire you ? Few Unix questions like OS, few basic commands that I use etc. Reason for leaving and reason for choosing this position.

title: Student Alternative Media Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted with the 3 employees that would be directly involved with my job responsibilities.  I knew the interviewers well and I believe that they had already made the decision to hire me, due to the fact that they knew my capabilities.
Interview Questions: None that were not expected.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Wooster, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended to a professor hiring a research assistant by another professor I had worked with. I emailed with him and then met with him and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: They asked about my familiarity with common lab tasks (like using a balance, for example).

title: Windows Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I did well in the class, so my professor approached me toward the end of the quarter to ask if I wanted to work for her.  I told her I was interested, and she had me contact the the supervisor of the Windows consultants.  My professor sent her recommendation of me, and I scheduled a time to meet with the supervisor for about 10 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you will be good in this position?

title: Library Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Email invitation for a Skype interview within 2 weeks after the job is closed. 1 Skype interview, 1 Physical interview afterwards. Background check. I remember background check took some time.
Interview Questions:
They do customize questions according to the jobs. So prepare yourself. For my job, I was asked about my experience, projects I worked on, how I overcame a difficult situation at work, etc.
I applied for a couple of other positions within the organization as well without success. As you can imagine, there will be many applicants for one opening.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Auditioned in February and then came to a full day callback two weeks later. Was offered a spot the following week. Then had to apply to the University and send in a portfolio/resume.
Interview Questions: What type of art do you like to create?

title: Athletic Camp Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: It mostly just consisted of the background check and also included an inquiry as to my athletic background. It is really all about a personal connection to the staff. Make sure to showcase any previous coaching experience.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with kids before?

title: Information Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very long and lenghty interview process. Took over a month for my position due to the amount of applications submitted.
Interview Questions: None that were too different than any other job.

title: Program Assistant- Fisher College of Business Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with department administrative associate, then called back for an additional interview with the dept chairperson and another administrative associate. Offered position over the phone the same day of second interview.  The whole process took probably one month.
Interview Questions: How would you be welcoming to students?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was fairly competitive but not as much so as for the RA position, and overall quite forgiving of people who may not have previously had a lot of work experience, which I think is/was a good thing. I really appreciated the connection that was already being established both by the OA staff manager (who was also an undergraduate student) and the building managers (who lived in the same building and were either graduate students or paraprofessionals).
Interview Questions: How would you handle possibly awkward (drunken, angry, fighting with a partner, breaking quiet hours) in the most positive way possible?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I got an email back from the manager in the Rare Books library and she set up an appointment. I was interviewed right in the rare books room. It took about 20 minutes and she asked me basic behavioral interview questions. I was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: They asked what type of books I am interested in.

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: You submit your application and then if accepted, you interview them.  Not at all like industry.  The key is finding a professor you like.  There are no questions in the interview, it is more like a talk about what you want to research and your interests and goals.  You just to have apply online and have a good resume with good grades and undergrad research.  It is nothing like applying for an industry job.
Interview Questions: The application asks why you want to go to grad school and what your interests are.  That is the hardest question because your answer should be about a page single spaced.  It can't be "I like learning" or something of that nature.

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: First interview with the staff and then second interview with faculty members.  They asked questions regarding my skills and expertise. They asked questions that would reveal the type of person I am to work with.
Interview Questions: Why did you chose this place to work.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with supervisor through a referral. Met once in person on-campus and was asked a serious of questions for about a half hour.  The supervisor oversaw the entire operation.
Interview Questions: Asked a serious of simple questions regarding ability to follow directions.  Basic competence and ability questions.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Once you take your math placement test to see where you stand going into your freshmen year of school, if your score is high enough, the math center coordinator may contact you asking for you to apply. You will fill out the simple application and they will review and get back to you about the interview. If selected, you go in to the math center for your interview and they will have a one-on-one interview session with you to access your math abilities. In my group, we had to perform a problem on the board for a group of both potential tutors and the staff. Not that difficult though because they know that we are students and this will not be a permanent job.
Interview Questions: We had to get in front of the group and solve a random math problem given to us.

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: on-site interview and a phone interview
Interview Questions: why do you leave your former employer?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: 2 months after submitting applications I was called in for interview. It was on the unit that was hiring with the manager of that unit. There were other nurses interviewing the same time slot. In between the interviews a staff member was reprimanded and left the office crying, which was a little concerning.  I was called back the following week and offered a position and given orientation start date.
Interview Questions: Can you give an example of a time you had to deal with conflict and how you dealt with that?

title: BIM Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Job was posted on the Engineering Career Services website through the university. I sent my resume via email after reviewing the content and requirements of the position. They called me back a few weeks later and were interested in an interview. Attended and was extended the job a few weeks afterward.
Interview Questions: What kind of teamwork experience do you have?

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Lawrence, KS) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on the OSU website, and search through the faculty member who is doing research on my interested topic. I send a email to the professor and he replied me with several questions.
Interview Questions: GPA and GRE score

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Searched OSU job board and emailed the professors who advertised. I was contacted back almost immediately asking to set up a one on one interview with the professor. Met with the professor in his office where we discussed my roles as a research assistant.
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in my field of research?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It is pre-selected; however, I believe that the initial phone interview plays an important role in graduate assistant selection.
Interview Questions: Not applicable

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter called me during evening, there is a 12 hours time difference between two countries. He asked every line and every word on my resume. It took more than 3 hours to finish the interview. The position is immediate, they want me to work there in the following month. I was not able to do so.
Interview Questions: What is the first project after I got my BS degree?

title: Ag Tech I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Wooster, OH) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: the interview and hiring process is slow!  Took a month after i sent in my resume to get an interview, then another month before I found out I had the job. The interview was a laid back one, with just 2 other people. But I have been to a few other interviews with the university where there were more than 5 people in the room.
Interview Questions: conflict

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed in a large conference room by several individuals. They were all easy going and friendly, so it wasn't a bad experience. They asked simple, general questions, most likely to find out more about my personality than the actual answer to the question. They interviewed 3 people in the span of 2 weeks, then called me and told me I got the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: This is extremely hard to say, as there appears to be no valid process since about a year ago, when an unqualified "Lecturer" was put in charge as "Director".  He seems to care about only 2 things to hire someone: 1) you should be a tech wizard, and 2) you should "like" him (or at least appear to).  Unbelievable, right?  That's what all of the older personnel say...
Interview Questions: Are you a computer wiz?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long, the all day
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come and work at OSU

title: Events Manager/Program Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Very informal discussion with the Manager of the Patron Services, as to wether i would stay or go.  It was my decision to leave as i already have a full time job.  Really enjoyed the peeps in Admin & in the technical workings of the Wex.  Very professional & knowledgeable group, who really know how to put on a first class show, at least while i was there.  I am not certain if the same staff is currently still there at this time.
Work culture is very university oriented & they are great at being very flexible schedule wise.  A great place to intern as well as use as a launchiing site for other untiversity endeavors.  great location on main campus @ OSU.  Hourly rate is competitive with other part-time & temporary positions in the area.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in working with front of house or patron services?

title: Engineering Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: No process, just contact professor.
Interview Questions: What are your interests?

title: Facilities Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications through proactive networking;  required to also apply online;  an interview was  promptly scheduled;  panel interview and participants were uninformed, did not have my resume and tried to apply behavior based interviewing questions ineffectively; one interviewer who was a direct hiring manager  was confrontational, lacked professionalism, and common courtesy;  culture lacks communications;  they need to be more conscientious of how the organization is represented;   ensure timely and clear communications; extended an offer 2+ months later after a series of internal circumstances partially due to policy and union affiliation policy
Interview Questions: "What do you think of people who don't show up to work?"

title: Clinical Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very disappointing.  The person who interviewed me was very suspicious about why I was leaving my previous position, asked for details, and then seemed really turned off by the details (I was coming from a department with ethics problems all the way up the chain of command, and I did not want to be a part of that).  He was very suspicious about me.  He seemed resentful to have to hire a new person-- because the previous person had gone on maternity leave and decided not to return (what WAS she thinking?  Obviously you should return to your hateful workplace even if you don't think it's the best thing for your new baby) and asked me where I saw myself in 5 years, which I thought was a bizarre question for a gopher job (I see myself as senior gopher?).  Now I realize it was code for "do you plan to have babies?  I don't wanna deal with maternity leave".  I am young, female, and engaged, so OF COURSE he must think the next thing on my list is to have a bunch of babies.  (It's not, but so what if it were?  Does he think it's his right to require that people not have children?)  He also wanted to know whether I had problems with my "attendance", which I found insulting.  I explained that in a year's time I had taken 1.5 days of vacation.  After being asked about my qualications/background I was told that I was more than qualified, that "anyone could do this job".  Of course, when I got the rejection email, I was told that they chose someone whose background was more suitable.  Whatever; it's hardly the environment I would want to work in.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your previous position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I found a professor's research webpage. His interests aligned with mine and so I send him my resume. I was at a different city at the time into which the Professor happened to fly in the same month. We arranged an interview at the Starbucks of an airport.
Interview Questions: The professor quizzed me on several technical aspects of a journal paper I was a co-author of. Most of them were manageable. He asked me what exactly my contribution was in that paper and why I was not first author on it.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an amazing experience. I talked to the professor who runs the laboratory and also to the research scientists. Everyone was very respectful and considerate. The questions were mostly about my previous research experience and lab techniques, as well as why I am interested to join this lab.
Interview Questions: What type of project would you like to work on?

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: Sit down with the manager, he asks about your leadership skills as well as how comfortable you are talking to new people
Interview Questions: What kind of sales experience do you have

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Recruited by Dept. Chair. Interview was very informal.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Typist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The Ohio State University (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: When I first applied to OSU, I submitted a paper application.  Several weeks later, I received a call asking me if I would like to come in for a test.  A few weeks after that, I was contacted by phone to come in for an interview.  I interviewed at the department that was hiring and was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: I think answering the required salary question is always the most difficult.  You don't want to ask for more than they are willing to pay but you don't want to sell yourself short either.
